title: Exploration: Integration SeCe-IT in Flamingo pt 2
description:
Description
Hi everyone,
  Thank you all for your participation and questions.
This is a summary, based on how i understood the discussion.
Please feel free to correct any misunderstandings, missed information so we are all on the same page.
  Meeting Notes Dominique:
Initial discussion of what solution we are currently decided on:
a: Solution: Live data
c: Key constraints/design points
Interactive â€“ Assuming the Display of a given â€ždefault or initialâ€œ Configuration
For each change in selection, e.g. a click on S4 for entstÃ¶rservice
a request to SeCe-IT will be made reflecting this change and
appropriate Data will be returned representing the new Configuration page configuration
NOT:
All Catalog data loaded and implementation of domain logic
Flamingo MS is, in this phase, a standardized User Interface for the Current Configuration provided by SeCe-IT
Flamingo MS has no contextual / domain logic for the products, only Frontend logic
Potential performance improvement â€“ Caching
List of Routers (or hardware in general)
Configuration page
Questions discussed:
KIP â€“ Kunden Individuelles Pricing
SeCe-IT can call Prima and provide the modified list price
Topics
Caching of request / responses
Preloading of a certain amount of data
Standardized / DT compliance regarding the Rest URLs
E.g.  what data in URL queries and what HTTP is used, e.g. POST(PATCH, PUT) instead of GET
Next steps:
Sece-IT
Provide a basic example of Rest Request-Response
Flamingo
How could / should the UI look and feel like? UX, Frontend Architecture
Different configurations currently offered in SeCe-IT Configurator e.g.
Radio buttons, Combo boxes, Check boxes, Numerical fields etc
Dynamic display based on the data provided on a request to request basis
Standardization, based on DT CI Standards and UX dev
Performance
Triggers â€“ When are configuration change requests sent
Caching/Preloading
Open Questions:
Performance / Scaleability: How many Users and configurations are performed at a givenen moment? Could this be a relevant requirement for SeCe-IT/Flamingo design?
Do we actually need to have a fully â€žchattyâ€œ version, where every change results in a request, or can we make the assumption that only one or two attributes actually result in a changed UI
Example: Kauf vs Gemietet (purchase vs rental)
Based on a discussion with Olaf, this is one of the only attributes, which actually change the potential UI display.
This raises the question: Can we just load once per day, or at least in smaller batches?
Note: A consequence of this solution would be potentially increased traffic and costs over the day (cloud, network etc) (ignoring Caching strategies and failover considerations)
    As mentioned this is my understanding from the meeting, so please feel free to add any missing points, or correct any mistakes by replying to this email(e.g. with a different colour) or ping or email me on teams by Monday 17/03/25 ðŸ˜Š
I will then add the corrected content with our shared understanding to the wiki and share it.
